description: 1 drawing on layered paper : ink, crayon, blue pencil and white out over pencil. | Cartoon shows the legs of Arkansas governor Orval Eugene Faubus visible underneath the bell which has fallen on his head. The bell, similar in shape to the Liberty Bell, is labeled "Little Rock School Board Election." On May 25, Pulaski County voters ousted many segregationists, with whom Faubus sided, from the school board and elected moderates.

medium: 1 drawing on layered paper : ink, crayon, blue pencil and white out over pencil.
mediums: 1 drawing on layered paper : ink, crayon, blue pencil and white out over pencil.
notes: Published in the St. Louis Post-Dispatch, May 27, 1959.
Exhibited in: With an even hand: Brown v. Board of Education at fifty years, Durham Western Heritage Museum, Omaha, Nebraska and other venues, 2005-2006.
Forms part of the Papers of Bill Mauldin (Library of Congress).

Papers of Bill Mauldin (Library of Congress)
